A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Disappointing. Had a huge opportunity here but missed the mark. The framework of the story is intriguing but the delivery and some of the decisions made are very mind-boggling. The Leia floating in space scene may be the single worst Star Wars scene ever filmed including anything involving Jar Jar Binks. It looked like a cheap knockoff of a Marvel Superheroes movie not Star Wars. And killing snoke without ever making him really matter makes no sense. I mean why? And then just phasing-out Luke very questionable. Where is this story heading? There's no momentum and seemingly no Direction heading into episode 9. I understand it Star Wars needs to break with the past a little bit and head into something new but I'm not sure this was the right way to do it. In fact I'm almost certain it was not.
